ygData.subject: Re: Chains overwriting shaman slowdown
ygData.msgSnippet: I m pretty sure once their attack slowdown spell (insects) is on that chain won t overwrite that.  They will not be able to cast it on if you already have
ygData.messageBody:
I'm pretty sure once their attack slowdown spell
(insects) is on that chain won't overwrite that. They
will not be able to cast it on if you already have
chain on. However, you should be able to notice this
for yourself. Our slowdown doesn't even come close to
comparing to the shaman's. You should visibly notice
if your chain was killing their slowdown. I'm pretty
sure I've stacked chain onto an enchanters slowdown
and the mob was still attacking VERY slow.

Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
45 1/2th level bard

> on another note, i'd love a definitive answer to
> this question, as it would
> allow me to start chaining sooner if i am the snarer
> in the group. i group
> with a shaman a lot, and obviously the shaman is in
> charge of slowing the
> mob. so, if the shaman slows the mob, and i chain
> the mob after, will the
> chain cancel the shaman's slowdown? i usually wait
> til close to when the
> mob is going to run cause i don't want to cancel the
> slow. if i am not
> going to cancel it then i can start snaring earlier,
> since i have recently
> become accustomed to getting resisted a ton.
>
> Shada Powa, L55 Wood Elf Troubador
> Tyria Sarkin, L50 High Elf Wizard
> <Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server
